str2: Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Strength (absolutely), power, might, force, ability. From a derivative of is; forcefulness.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
Slanderous; subst: a blasphemer. From a derivative of blapto and pheme; scurrilious, i.e. Calumnious, or impious.
Decision; by extension, a tribunal; by implication, justice.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
